<!-- Each team member should list their current skills relevant to their selected IT career path.
Use a numerical scale (1-5) to indicate proficiency levels:
1 = Beginner
2 = Basic knowledge
3 = Intermediate
4 = Advanced
5 = Expert -->

## Team Skill Level Dataframe
```{python}
import pandas as pd

skills_data = {
    "Name": ["Ava", "Mahira", "Joshua"],
    "Python": [3, 3, 3],
    "SQL": [3, 1, 4],
    "Machine Learning": [2, 3, 2],
    "Cloud Computing": [1, 1, 1]
}

df_skills = pd.DataFrame(skills_data)
df_skills.set_index("Name", inplace=True)
df_skills
```

## Visualizing Skill Gaps in Heatmpa with Plotly

```{python}
import kaleido
import plotly.express as px
fig = px.imshow(df_skills,
 labels=dict(x="Skill", y="Team Member Name", color="Skill Self Rating"),
 title="Key IT Skill Rating Heatmap per Team Member"
)
fig.update_layout(
  title=dict(
    text="Key IT Skill Rating Heatmap per Team Member",
    font=dict(size=24, family="Arial", color="black", weight="bold")
  ),
  xaxis=dict(
    title=dict(text="Skill", font=dict(size=20, family="Arial", color="black", weight="bold")),
    tickangle=90,
    tickfont=dict(size=10, family="Arial", color="black", weight="bold"),
    showline=True,
    linewidth=2,
    linecolor="black",
    mirror=True,
    showgrid=True,
  ),
  yaxis=dict(
    title=dict(text="Teammember Name", font=dict(size=20, family="Arial", color="black", weight="bold")),
    showline=True,
    linewidth=2,
    linecolor="black",
    mirror=True,
    showgrid=True,
    gridcolor="lightgray",
    gridwidth=0.5
  ),
  font=dict(family="Arial", size=16, color="black"),
  paper_bgcolor="#DCDCDC",
  showlegend=True,
)
fig.show()
fig.write_image("figures/skill_heatmap.png")
fig.write_html("figures/skill_heatmap.html")
```
